rounds.response:
I hold just queen-high with a back-door flush draw.  
The bet is 40 into an 80 pot, so I need 33 % equity to call.  
With Q-high, gut-wheel possibilities and one overcard I only have ≈25–27 % equity versus a typical flop, so it’s a slight fold.  
More importantly, P0’s sizing screams strength (often a king or better).  
Spending 40 now, out of position, risks bloating the pot with a marginal hand.

[Fold]
